laboratory_examinations.findings: 17.1 mmol per liter (normal <2.1 mmol per liter); lactate:pyruvate ratio 38 (normal 12 to 18)
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Profound metabolic acidosis was evident from day 10 of life.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Elevation of direct bilirubin observed, progressed to full liver failure by day 12.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressed to full liver failure by day 12 and death on day 27.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Activities of Oxidative Phosphorylation Complexes in Fibroblasts
laboratory_examinations.findings: Complex I: 40% of the lowest control value; Complex III: 69% of the lowest control value; Complex IV: 18% of the lowest control value.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Activities of Oxidative Phosphorylation Complexes in Muscle
laboratory_examinations.findings: Complex I activity: 52% of the lowest control value; Complex IV activity: 54% of the lowest control value.
Maximum blood lactate level was 9.3 mmol per liter, lactate:pyruvate ratio of 84.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Signs of liver failure were present at week 7, leading to death at five months of age.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Activities of Complex I and IV in Fibroblasts of Male Sibling
laboratory_examinations.findings: Complex I: 13% of the lowest control value; Complex IV: 31% of the lowest control value.
Overall mitochondrial translation decreased to about 20% of controls; Complex IV subunits reduced to about 15% of control equivalents.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Overexpression of EFG1 partially rectified the translation to about 40% of control equivalents.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Complex IV Activity after EFG1 Overexpression
laboratory_examinations.findings: Complex IV activity increased from 20% to 72% of control levels.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increase in the amount of fully assembled complexes I, III, IV, and V observed.
